Detailed Description

A layout with a central widget.

Since:
0.7.2.0

This layout is decomposed with a center widget and four border. Methods add() and addWidget() as a second parameter position used to define where you place your widget.

You can add multiple widget at the same position.

For more detail on this class, you can read the documentation of trolltech/nokia.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum BorderLayout::Position

Position of the widget in the layout

Enumerator:
West 

The widget is placed at the left

North 

The widget is placed at the top

South 

The widget is placed at the bottom

East 

The widget is placed at the right

Center 

The widget is placed in the center

Qt::Orientations BorderLayout::expandingDirections (  )  const [virtual]

Returns whether this layout item can make use of more space than sizeHint().

Returns Qt::Vertical | Qt::Horizontal to tell that the layout can grow in both dimensions.

bool BorderLayout::hasHeightForWidth (  )  const [virtual]

Returns false to tell that this layout's preferred width depends on its height.

QSize BorderLayout::minimumSize (  )  const [virtual]

Return the minimum size of the widget.

This method use the minimum size of the different elements added to the layout to known the minimum size.
